intro: Dasystephana obtusiloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dasystephana, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
